item.description:
Let the Great World Spin (368 pages) was recently recommended to me and has received numerous good reviews.

"The novel has also been touted as an allegory of the events of 9/11. It is a novel about life and death, love and grief, and hope. Taking place in New York City in 1974, on the day that Philippe Petit walked on a tightrope between the World Trade Center towers, the story merges the lives and losses of seemingly unrelated people. The chapters tell the stories of different characters; some related to each other some closely, some remotely. They are all somehow touched by the events taking place in the 110th floor of the two towers." It truely sounds like an excellent book. I look forward to a lively discussion
item.how_to_find_us: I wanted to try a new place. I will have the book on the table for identifications purposes.
item.name: Discuss "Let the Great World Spin" by Colum McCann
